data.text: Here is why a subscription-based app business is like a strategy game ğŸš€ Building charisme feels like a complex numbers game where our current goal is to become cash-flow positive. Letâ€™s break this all down into some easy-to-understand formulas ğŸ§® Cash Flow positive = ğŸ’° in > ğŸ’°out which could be written as ğŸ’° Revenue > Taxes + Marketing spend + Salaries + Overhead We need to scale ğŸ’° revenue to cover salaries and overhead. This means that we will also scale our marketing spend. For this to be profitable, we need ğŸ’°revenue per user > ğŸ’¸ cost of acquiring a new user Letâ€™s dive deeper into ğŸ’°revenue per user. ğŸ’°revenue per user = % Trial Started (percentage of users that start our free trial) * % Trial to Subscription (percentage of users that donâ€™t cancel the trial) * ğŸ™‹â™€ï¸ Customer Lifetime Value (CLV) Here, we could dive deeper once again, e.g., the ğŸ™‹â™€ï¸ CLV (simplified) = Revenue per year / (1 / ğŸ”¥ Churn Rate). ğŸ”¥ Churn Rate is the percentage of users that cancel their subscription. Decreasing the yearly churn rate from 70% to 55% would increase the ğŸ’°revenue per user by 26%. This is where the thought of â€œit is like a gameâ€ comes into play. Changing one factor down the line has a significant influence on the overall result. Letâ€™s look at the ğŸ’¸ cost of acquiring a new user. Here, we can go as deep as we like too, but we will keep it simple. ğŸ’¸cost of acquiring a new user = âš ï¸ Cost per click on our Ad (leads potential users to our app store page) * ğŸ“± App Store Page Conversion Rate. This implies that doubling theğŸ“± App Store Page Conversion Rate halves the ğŸ’¸ cost of acquiring a new user. Thinking about your business that way gives you MANY variables that have significant influence. As an early-stage startup, we try to focus on those that are flexible and easy to change, such as theğŸ“± App Store Page Conversion Rate, which was behind industry benchmarks until recently. I will provide a series of the most important KPIs for us and how we intend to improve them in the next couple of weeks ğŸš€
